entries.title: Email Campaign
entries.definition: A coordinated marketing effort using email to achieve a specific goal. HubSpot tracks campaign performance including opens, clicks, replies, and conversions.

entries.title: Open Rate
entries.definition: The percentage of delivered emails that were opened by recipients. Calculated as (Opens / Delivered) x 100. Industry average varies but typically ranges from 15-25%.

entries.title: Click-Through Rate
entries.definition: The percentage of email recipients who clicked on at least one link in the email. Calculated as (Clicks / Delivered) x 100. A key metric for measuring email engagement and content effectiveness.

entries.title: Conversion Rate
entries.definition: The percentage of visitors who complete a desired action (form submission, purchase, signup). Calculated as (Conversions / Total Visitors) x 100. Critical for measuring campaign and landing page effectiveness.

entries.title: Bounce Rate
entries.definition:
The percentage of sent emails that couldn't be delivered:

  • Hard Bounce - Permanent failure (invalid email)
  • Soft Bounce - Temporary failure (full inbox)

High bounce rates harm sender reputation.

entries.title: A/B Test
entries.definition: A method of comparing two versions of an email, landing page, or CTA to determine which performs better. HubSpot allows testing subject lines, content, send times, and more.

entries.title: Drip Campaign
entries.definition: An automated email sequence that sends pre-written messages to leads over time. Drip campaigns nurture prospects by delivering relevant content based on their behavior and interests.

entries.title: Lead Magnet
entries.definition: A valuable piece of content offered in exchange for a visitor's contact information. Examples include ebooks, whitepapers, templates, webinars, and free tools. The foundation of inbound lead generation.

entries.title: Marketing Automation
entries.definition: Technology that automatically manages marketing processes and campaigns across multiple channels. In HubSpot, this includes workflows, sequences, lead scoring, and personalization.

entries.title: Segmentation
entries.definition: Dividing your audience into distinct groups based on shared characteristics like demographics, behavior, or interests. Enables personalized messaging and targeted campaigns for better engagement.
